sentences.sContent: He lured her to his home and shot her with his father's gun.
sentences.sCn: 他把她诱骗到家里，然后用父亲的枪把她打死。

sentences.sContent: ...Macy’s has simply struggled to lure consumers who are more interested in spending on travel or dining out than on new clothes or accessories...
...Store owners can lure you to the candy aisle...

trans.tranOther: to persuade someone to do something, especially something wrong or dangerous, by making it seem attractive or exciting

trans.tranCn: 吸引力， 诱惑物； 诱饵， 鱼饵
trans.tranOther: something that attracts people, or the quality of being able to do this
